channel.title: Best way to go about combatting people bypassing auth through changing auth api
channel.description: So recently I released an application that fought off reversers pretty well for as long as it did last. Unfortunately someone very skilled at reversing managed to change the api my tool was sending requests to. How can I prevent something like this happening in the future with Keyauth?

item.title: Best way to go about combatting people bypassing auth through changing auth api
item.dc:creator: mak
item.description:
Ah you’re c#. The link I sent above is c++. c# is inherently easier for attackers to deobfuscate given the fact it leaves behind far more metadata than c++

item.title: Best way to go about combatting people bypassing auth through changing auth api
item.dc:creator: Scxr
item.description:
I pay for a per file obfuscation and have limited details on what is actually in the obfuscation and protection included with it, it’s enough to stop low to mid level reversers but when you have a entire forum trying to reverse it it’s sort of hard to prevent

Read full topic
item.source: Best way to go about combatting people bypassing auth through changing auth api

item.title: Best way to go about combatting people bypassing auth through changing auth api
item.dc:creator: Weebzo
item.description:
Enable hash checks on keyauth and if the obfuscator you’re using has anti tamper use it aswell
